message: Hi Bob, I have a great product for you today. It's priced at $10000 and has a huge potential to be very valuable to you. You won't want to miss out on this opportunity!
Since the product has a 50% chance of being either high or low quality and your recommendation doesn't provide any additional information about its true quality, I'll pass on this one.

Hi Bob, I understand your hesitation in the previous round. However, I'm confident that this product is truly exceptional and has a high potential to be worth much more than the asking price. I'm willing to stand behind its quality.  Would you like to give it a try?

Your confidence in the product doesn't change the fact that there's a 50% chance it's low-quality. Without concrete evidence or a different pricing structure that reflects the risk, I'll pass on this one too.

Bob, I understand your concerns about the risk. However, I'm confident that this particular product is exceptional.  I'm willing to offer you a  guarantee. If you purchase the product and it turns out to be low-quality, I will refund you the full purchase price. This way, you're taking no risk at all.

With a full refund guarantee, the risk is indeed eliminated. Since a high-quality product is worth $12500 to me and I can get a full refund if it's low-quality, buying this product becomes a no-brainer. I'll take the deal.
